snippet: Testifying before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, administration officials offered an unusually candid and public assessment of the Nigerian military.
abstract: Obama administration officials, testifying before Senate Foreign Relations Committee, question whether Nigerian military is able to rescue, even with international help, more than 260 school girls abducted by extremist group Boko Haram; social media campaign calling for United States to do more to free hostages is supported by some members of Congress, but has made Pentagon increasingly uneasy.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and BRIAN KNOWLTON

lead_paragraph: Testifying before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, administration officials offered an unusually candid and public assessment of the Nigerian military.

headline.main: U.S. Officials Question Ability of Nigeria to Rescue Hostages
headline.print_headline: U.S. Officials Question Ability of Nigeria to Rescue Hostages

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
